page.title: 12Life as a Cub Scout W.Grove
page.content: On 24th May, I went on a cub camp at Didcot Power Station Reserve. On arrival we made our beds and pitched our tents. After lunch of stew and dumplings was an inspection and some football. On our return we cooked fish fingers and spaghetti. Then we had 15 minutes free time. Bedtime was at 10.00 pm. In the morning, we had Inspection, then breakfast. We worked on our Scientist Badge. On the last day, I was judged the tidiest, cleanest Cub Scout and won a shield. Other summer events included a St. George's Day Parade on April 28th, when Scouts and Cubs marched to Wantage Church, a District Rally at Uffington, when all the packs had games on White Horse Hill, and the District Athletics when we all competed against each other.
